trigger.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/PagefilePercentUsage)>{$PAGEFILE.WARN} and last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/PagefilePercentUsage)<{$PAGEFILE.HIGH}
trigger.name: Pagefile % Usage hit threshold (>90% <95%). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
Pagefile % Usage hit threshold. (>95%). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

trigger.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/system.cpu.util)<{$CPU.UTIL.CRIT} and last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/system.cpu.util)>={$CPU.UTIL.WARN}
trigger.name: Percentage CPU Utilization hit threshold. (>85 <90). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

dependency.name: Percentage CPU Utilization hit threshold. (>90). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

trigger.name: Percentage CPU Utilization hit threshold. (>90). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

trigger.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/system.uptime)>10m and last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/system.uptime)<=20m
trigger.name: Uptime hit threshold (<1200 >600). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
Physical Memory % Usage hit threshold. (>95%). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

trigger.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vm.memory.util)>{$MEMORY.USED.WARN} and last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vm.memory.util)<{$MEMORY.USED.HIGH}
trigger.name: Physical Memory % Usage hit threshold. (>95%). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
Zabbix agent is not available (for {$AGENT.TIMEOUT})
trigger.description: For passive only agents, host availability is used with {$AGENT.TIMEOUT} as time threshold.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: The number of incoming packets dropped on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: The number of incoming packets with errors on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: Incoming traffic on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: The number of outgoing packets dropped on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: The number of outgoing packets with errors on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: Outgoing traffic on the network interface.

item_prototype.name: Network {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface Status
item_prototype.description: The operational status of the network interface.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"])=2 and (last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"],#1)<>last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"],#2))=1)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Output Queue Length
item_prototype.description: This measures the length of the output packet queue, in packets. There is network saturation if the value is more than 2. You can address this problem by adding a faster network card or segmenting the network.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/perf_counter_en[\Network Interface(*)\Output Queue Length, 60])>0
trigger_prototype.name: [{HOST.NAME}] Average Network Output Queue Length

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/perf_counter_en[\Network Interface(*)\Output Queue Length, 60])>2
trigger_prototype.name: [{HOST.NAME}] Average Network Output Queue Length

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/net.if.in["{#IFNAME}",errors],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or min(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/net.if.out["{#IFNAME}",errors],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/net.if.in["{#IFNAME}",errors],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and max(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/net.if.out["{#IFNAME}",errors],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"])=2 and (last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"],#1)<>last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/net.if.status["{#IFNAME}"],#2))=1)

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Average Disk Queue Length
item_prototype.description: Current average disk queue, the number of requests outstanding on the disk at the time the performance data is collected.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.dev.queue_size[CurrentDiskQueueLength.{#DEVNAME}])>= 1 and last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.dev.queue_size[CurrentDiskQueueLength.{#DEVNAME}]) < 2
trigger_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Average Disk Queue Length hit threshold (>=1 <2). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
{#DEVNAME}: Average Disk Queue Length hit threshold (>=2). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.dev.read.rate[DiskBytesPersec{#DEVNAME}])> 99999998 and last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.dev.read.rate[DiskBytesPersec{#DEVNAME}])< 99999999
trigger_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk Bytes Per sec hit threshold (>99999998 <99999999). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
{#DEVNAME}: Disk Bytes Per sec hit threshold. (>99999999). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.dev.read.rate[PercentDiskReadTime{#DEVNAME}])>{$VFS.DEV.READ.UTIL.MAX.WARN} and last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.dev.read.rate[PercentDiskReadTime{#DEVNAME}])<{$VFS.DEV.READ.UTIL.MAX.CRIT}
trigger_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: % Disk Read Time hit threshold (>80 <90). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
{#DEVNAME}: % Disk Read Time hit threshold. (>90). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.dev.read.rate[PercentDiskWriteTime{#DEVNAME}])>{$VFS.DEV.WRITE.UTIL.MAX.WARN} and last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.dev.read.rate[PercentDiskWriteTime{#DEVNAME}])<{$VFS.DEV.WRITE.UTIL.MAX.CRIT}
trigger_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: % Disk Write Time hit threshold (>80 <90). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
{#DEVNAME}: % Disk Write Time hit threshold. (>90). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and ((last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total])-last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used]))<10G or timeleft(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused],1h,100)<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: % Used Space hit threshold. (>85 <=90 ). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 10G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}:% Used Space hit threshold. (>90). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
dependency.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and ((last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total])-last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used]))<5G or timeleft(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused],1h,100)<1d)

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused])>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and ((last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total])-last(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used]))<5G or timeleft(/Template OS Windows INTEROP Custom/vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused],1h,100)<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}:% Used Space hit threshold. (>90). Current value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 5G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
